record.dc:title: 268SW20 Indian Bluff Site 30SW20, Stewart County, Tennessee. Burials 30SW98, 30SW101, 30SW136, 30SW135. Cover slabs after removal of burials. Direction from foot of burials.
record.wpa:narrative: [30SW98] Top slabs present, overlain by bottom slabs of 30SW102 on SE side. Position of remaining leg bones indicates possible flexure. If this is true, the skeleton has probably been placed in a cist built for an extended burial. [30SW101] Top and bottom slabs present. Both sides were to west, although only western side is shown, thus 30SW101A is intruded into 30SW101. Most of the middle of 30SW101 is gone. The right femur was disturbed and dragged up to the skull. [30SW101A] Intruded into thorax of 30SW101. See 101 for sketch. [30SW136] Full top, head, and foot stones were all that remained of the cist. No sides or bottom slabs. Feet disturbed, thorax rotted, otherwise in fair shape. [30SW135] Complete top, bottom, side, and end slabs. The skull was broken and somewhat scattered. Thorax was disturbed. 30SW135A lay in a bundle over the lower legs of 30SW135. 30SW135A was a bundle of long bones, foot bones, teeth, etc. of a previous occupant of this cist. [30SW135A] See 30SW135 for remarks.
record.wpa:comments: Observer illustrations on file at the institution.
